db_diff_checker_gui2

Class Database

  • java.lang.Object
    • db_diff_checker_gui2.Database

  • public class Database
extends java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Database()
      This is the default constructor for this class which is needed for the file conversion to JSON.
      Database(Db_conn db)
      Database initializes a Database object by using a database connection.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> compareTables(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,Table> liveTables)
      compareTables determines which table(s) is/are to be created or dropped.
      java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getFirstSteps()
      getFirstSteps returns the first steps to be taken in order to run the SQL statements.
      java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,Table> getTables()
      getTables returns an HashMap of tables that are in the database provided.
      java.util.ArrayList<Views> getViews()
      getViews returns an ArrayList of Views objects which is the all of the views in the database provided.
      java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> tablesDiffs(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,Table> liveTables)
      tablesDiffs compares the two HashMaps which represent the tables in the live and dev databases, and returns a HashMap of table names whose structure did not match between the dev and live databases.
      java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> updateTables(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,Table> live, java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> update_tables)
      updateTables takes in two table lists which are HashMaps, and returns the SQL statements to run in order to make the live database have the same table definitions as the dev one.
      java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> updateViews(java.util.ArrayList<Views> liveViews)
      updateViews takes in a list of views and returns the SQL statements needed to make the two databases have the exact same views.

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Database

        public Database(Db_conn db)
        Database initializes a Database object by using a database connection. the database provided connection is used to initialize a HashMap of tables and views that exist in the database provided and get SQL statements to drop all Primary Keys and remove all auot_increments in the database provided which will only be used on the live database.
        Parameters:
        db - is a Db_conn connection which is used to get db information

      • Database

        public Database()
        This is the default constructor for this class which is needed for the file conversion to JSON.

    • Method Detail

      • getFirstSteps

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getFirstSteps()
        getFirstSteps returns the first steps to be taken in order to run the SQL statements. These SQL statements are used to drop Primary Keys and remove auto_increments on the database provided. Note: this funntion will return an empty ArrayList if the function is called on the dev database.
        Returns:
        firstSteps is an ArrayList of Strings which is the first steps to be taken in order to run the SQL statements

      • getTables

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,Table> getTables()
        getTables returns an HashMap of tables that are in the database provided. The key is the name of the table and the value is a Table object.
        Returns:
        tables is an HashMap with a set of String and Table objects which is all of the tables in the database provided.

      • getViews

        public java.util.ArrayList<Views> getViews()
        getViews returns an ArrayList of Views objects which is the all of the views in the database provided.
        Returns:
        views is an ArrayList of View objects which represent all of the views in the database provided.

      • updateViews

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> updateViews(java.util.ArrayList<Views> liveViews)
        updateViews takes in a list of views and returns the SQL statements needed to make the two databases have the exact same views. Note: all views in the live database will be dropped and all from the dev database will be created.
        Parameters:
        liveViews - is an ArrayList of Views objects which is all of the views in the live database.
        Returns:
        sql is an ArrayList of Strings which is the SQL statements to run in order to make the live database have the same views as the dev one.

      • compareTables

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> compareTables(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,Table> liveTables)
        compareTables determines which table(s) is/are to be created or dropped.
        Parameters:
        liveTables - is a HashMap of String and Table object pairs which represent all tables in the live database.
        Returns:
        sql is an ArrayList of Strings which is the SQL statements to run in order to remove and/or create tables in the live database.

      • updateTables

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> updateTables(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,Table> live,
                                                          java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> update_tables)
        updateTables takes in two table lists which are HashMaps, and returns the SQL statements to run in order to make the live database have the same table definitions as the dev one.
        Parameters:
        live - is a HashMap of String and Table object pairs which are the names of the tables and table data for each table in the live database.
        update_tables - is a HashMap of String and String pairs where the key and the value are the same, which is all the tables which are not the same in the live and dev databases.
        Returns:
        sql is an ArrayList of Strings which is the SQL statements to run in order to make the live database have the same table definitions as the dev one.

      • tablesDiffs

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> tablesDiffs(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,Table> liveTables)
        tablesDiffs compares the two HashMaps which represent the tables in the live and dev databases, and returns a HashMap of table names whose structure did not match between the dev and live databases.
        Parameters:
        liveTables - is a HashMap of String and Table object pairs which are the table names and table data for all tables in the live database.
        Returns:
        update_tables is an HashMap which is the tables that are to be updated because their structures did not match between the dev and live databases.
